title: Healer/dNetHack
data:
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [ ]## Contents* [1 Starting equipment](#Starting_equipment)
* [2 Intrinsics](#Intrinsics)
* [3 Attributes](#Attributes)
* [4 Skills](#Skills)
* [5 Special rules](#Special_rules)
* [6 Rank titles](#Rank_titles)
* [7 Gods](#Gods)
* [8 Quest](#Quest)
* [9 Strategy](#Strategy) |

In dNetHack, the **Healer** is one of the [roles](/wiki/Role "Role") available to the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero").

Healers can be [humans](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)"), [gnomes](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)"), [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)"), or [yuki-onna](/wiki/Yuki-onna_\(starting_race\) "Yuki-onna (starting race)"), and are always [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral").

[Drow Healers](/index.php?title=Drow_Healer\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Drow Healer (page does not exist)") and hedrow Healers are treated as radically different from their counterparts, with their own articles available in the provided link.

## Starting equipment

Each Healer starts with the following equipment:

- 1001-2000 [gold pieces](/wiki/Gold_piece "Gold piece")
- a blessed +0 [scalpel](/wiki/Scalpel "Scalpel")
- a blessed +0 [quarterstaff](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff")
- an uncursed +1 pair of [gloves](/wiki/Leather_gloves "Leather gloves")
- a blessed +0 [healer uniform](/index.php?title=Healer_uniform\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Healer uniform (page does not exist)")
- a blessed +0 pair of [low boots](/wiki/Low_boots "Low boots")
- 5-10 uncursed [apples](/wiki/Apple "Apple")
- 5-10 blessed [eucalyptus leaves](/wiki/Eucalyptus_leaves "Eucalyptus leaves")
- a blessed [spellbook of healing](/wiki/Spellbook_of_healing "Spellbook of healing")
- a blessed [spellbook of extra healing](/wiki/Spellbook_of_extra_healing "Spellbook of extra healing")
- a blessed [spellbook of stone to flesh](/wiki/Spellbook_of_stone_to_flesh "Spellbook of stone to flesh")
- 4 non-cursed [potions of healing](/wiki/Potions_of_healing "Potions of healing")
- 4 non-cursed [potions of extra healing](/wiki/Potions_of_extra_healing "Potions of extra healing")
- [wand of sleep](/wiki/Wand_of_sleep "Wand of sleep") (4-8 charges)
- an uncursed [stethoscope](/wiki/Stethoscope "Stethoscope")
- an uncursed [oil lamp](/wiki/Oil_lamp "Oil lamp")

Healers start with knowledge of the [potion of full healing](/wiki/Potion_of_full_healing "Potion of full healing")'s randomized appearance.

The Healer's default starting [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") is a [little dog](/wiki/Little_dog "Little dog") or [kitten](/wiki/Kitten "Kitten") with equal probability.

## Intrinsics

Healers gain the following intrinsic [properties](/wiki/Properties "Properties") upon reaching the given [experience levels](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level"):

- Level 1: [Poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance")
- Level 1: [Immunity to sickness](/wiki/Immunity_to_sickness "Immunity to sickness")
- Level 15: [Warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning")

## Attributes

The Healer's starting [attributes](/wiki/Attribute "Attribute") are distributed as follows:

| Attributes               | [Strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength") | [Dexterity](/wiki/Dexterity "Dexterity") | [Constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution") | [Intelligence](/wiki/Intelligence "Intelligence") | [Wisdom](/wiki/Wisdom "Wisdom") | [Charisma](/wiki/Charisma "Charisma") | Remaining |
| ------------------------ | ------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------- | ------------------------------------- | --------- |
| Minimum attributes       | 7                                     | 7                                        | 11                                                | 13                                                | 11                              | 16                                    | 10        |
| Distribution percentages | 5%                                    | 15%                                      | 25%                                               | 30%                                               | 20%                             | 5%                                    |           |

## Skills

Healers have the following [skills](/wiki/Skill "Skill") available to them before racial adjustments:

| Healer skills |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| ------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Max           | [Skills](/wiki/Skill "Skill")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Basic         | - *Weapons:* [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar"), [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber"), [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace"), [polearms](/wiki/Polearms "Polearms"), [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear"), [javelin](/wiki/Javelin "Javelin"), [trident](/wiki/Trident "Trident")
- *Combat:* [bare hands](/wiki/Bare_hands "Bare hands")
- *Spells:* [wand damage](/wiki/Wands_Balance_Patch "Wands Balance Patch")                                   |
| Skilled       | * *Weapons:* [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"), [club](/wiki/Club "Club"), [sling](/wiki/Sling "Sling"), [shuriken](/wiki/Shuriken "Shuriken")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| Expert        | - *Weapons:* [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife"), [quarterstaff](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff"), [farm implements](/index.php?title=Farm_implements\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Farm implements (page does not exist)"), [dart](/wiki/Dart "Dart"), [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn")
- *Combat:* [beast mastery](/wiki/Beast_mastery "Beast mastery")
- *Spells:* [healing](/wiki/Healing_spells "Healing spells") |

Healers start with *Basic* skill in *knife*, *quarterstaff* and *healing spells*, and use the intelligence stat to cast spells. Their [special spell](/wiki/Special_spell "Special spell") is [full healing](/index.php?title=Spellbook_of_full_healing\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Spellbook of full healing (page does not exist)").

## Special rules

Healers gain experience and a +1 [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") bonus for healing [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet") and peaceful monsters.

Healers do not suffer damage or [attribute](/wiki/Attribute "Attribute") loss from quaffing a [potion of sickness](/wiki/Potion_of_sickness "Potion of sickness") and are immune to their [vapors](/wiki/Vapor "Vapor"), though quaffing the potion will still cure [hallucination](/wiki/Hallucination "Hallucination").

A Healer can apply a stethoscope to a [statue](/wiki/Statue "Statue") to determine whether it contains items or is on a [statue trap](/wiki/Statue_trap "Statue trap"); they can also more reliably apply a stethoscope to themselves while [engulfed](/wiki/Engulfed "Engulfed") by a [whirly](/wiki/Whirly "Whirly") monster.

Healers gain a +10 bonus to their natural [HP](/wiki/HP "HP") regeneration rate and a +6 bonus to their natural [power](/wiki/Power "Power") regeneration rate.

Healers have an increased chance of obtaining a tame [minion](/wiki/Minion "Minion") from an [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") as a [sacrifice](/wiki/Sacrifice "Sacrifice") boon.

Healers gain reduced spell failure rates for all spells while wielding a [khakkhara](/wiki/Khakkhara "Khakkhara"), [bell](/wiki/Bell "Bell"), [effigy](/wiki/Effigy "Effigy"), or scalpel (including [artifacts](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact")).

Healers can safely extract the fang from the hearts of [Jrt Netjer](/wiki/Jrt_Netjer "Jrt Netjer") in hell vaults, and can safely free monsters from vivisection traps - this will tame the monster in both cases.

Healers have a +0.5 [base attack bonus](/index.php?title=Base_attack_bonus\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Base attack bonus (page does not exist)") per experience level, and gain [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and damage bonuses for attacks with scalpels and unicorn horns based on their skill in healing spells: +0 for Basic, +2 for Skilled, and +5 for Expert.

Healers can make [sneak attacks](/wiki/Sneak_attack_\(dNetHack\) "Sneak attack (dNetHack)") with knives.

Healers are capable of determining roughly how much HP a vampiric or living monster has left: A phrase is appended to the monster's name whenever the Healer sees them take any action, and is also displayed when using [far look](/wiki/Far_look "Far look").

Healers apply a bonus to their pets' threshold for experience gain, maximum level, [AC](/wiki/AC "AC"), and [DR](/wiki/DR "DR") based on each of their skills in beast mastery and healing spells: +1 for Basic, +2 for Skilled, and +5 for Expert. Wielding [Clarent](/wiki/Clarent "Clarent") or carrying it as an alternate weapon doubles the bonuses from beast mastery.

## Rank titles

The [status line](/wiki/Status_line "Status line") displays one of the following ranks for the corresponding experience levels:

- XL 1-2: Rhizotomist
- XL 3-5: Empiric
- XL 6-9: Embalmer
- XL 10-13: Dresser
- XL 14-17: Medicus ossium/Medica ossium
- XL 18-21: Herbalist
- XL 22-25: Magister/Magistra
- XL 26-29: Physician
- XL 30: Chirurgeon

## Gods

- *Main article: [Religion](/wiki/Religion "Religion")*

The standard Healer pantheon is based on [the mythology of ancient Greece](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greek_mythology "wikipedia:Greek mythology").

- Lawful: [Athena](/wiki/Athena "Athena")
- Neutral: [Hermes](/wiki/Hermes "Hermes")
- Chaotic: [Poseidon](/wiki/Poseidon "Poseidon")

## Quest

- *Main article: [Healer quest/dNetHack](/index.php?title=Healer_quest/dNetHack\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Healer quest/dNetHack (page does not exist)")*

As in [the standard quest](/wiki/Healer_quest "Healer quest") for *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the Healer's [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") sees them fighting the [Cyclops](/wiki/Cyclops "Cyclops") for [The Staff of Aesculapius](/wiki/The_Staff_of_Aesculapius "The Staff of Aesculapius"), an artifact [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver")-shod [serpent-entwined staff](/wiki/Serpent-entwined_staff "Serpent-entwined staff"). Additionally, the Healer will encounter many monsters that have fallen victim to a plague inflicted upon them by the Cyclops and his machinations.

A Healer can gain access to their quest if the average of their experience level and the [monster level](/wiki/Monster_level "Monster level") of their pet with the highest level is 14 or higher.

The Staff of Aesculapius grants hungerless [regeneration](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration") and [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") while [wielded](/wiki/Wield "Wield"), and deals [double damage](/wiki/Double_damage "Double damage") to all monsters without [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") and drains levels from them on each hit - this life-draining applies a further +1d8 damage to the target's current and maximum HP, and restores half of that damage to the wielder's current HP. [Invoking](/wiki/Invoking "Invoking") The Staff of Aesculapius heals the user by half of the HP needed to return to full health, and cures [sickness](/wiki/Sickness "Sickness"), [blindness](/wiki/Blindness "Blindness") not caused by gunk (e.g. from a [cream pie](/wiki/Cream_pie "Cream pie")) and [sliming](/wiki/Sliming "Sliming"). [Reading](/wiki/Reading "Reading") The Staff of Aesculapius teaches the [mass healing](/index.php?title=Spellbook_of_mass_healing\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Spellbook of mass healing (page does not exist)") spell. [Applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") the non-cursed Staff can cure status ailments for the wielder or other allied monsters similar to a [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn"), and inflicts status ailments on opposing monsters while completely ignoring [monster MR](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") - this is reversed if the Staff is cursed, and in all cases skips over ailments that do not apply (for curing) or else cannot be applied (for inflicting). The status ailments cured or applied in order of priority are: blindness, [deafness](/wiki/Deafness "Deafness"), [stunning](/wiki/Stunning "Stunning") and [confusion](/wiki/Confusion "Confusion"), [sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep"), [paralysis](/wiki/Paralysis "Paralysis"), [cancellation](/wiki/Cancellation "Cancellation"), and plague.

## Strategy

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Detail to match the layout of other NetHack role strategy sections if possible."*

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Healer/dNetHack

From NetHackWiki
< Healer
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Contents

  • 1 Starting equipment
  • 2 Intrinsics
  • 3 Attributes
  • 4 Skills
  • 5 Special rules
  • 6 Rank titles
  • 7 Gods
  • 8 Quest
  • 9 Strategy

In dNetHack, the Healer is one of the roles available to the hero.

Healers can be humans, gnomes, elves, or yuki-onna, and are always neutral.

Drow Healers and hedrow Healers are treated as radically different from their counterparts, with their own articles available in the provided link.

Starting equipment

Each Healer starts with the following equipment:

  • 1001-2000 gold pieces
  • a blessed +0 scalpel
  • a blessed +0 quarterstaff
  • an uncursed +1 pair of gloves
  • a blessed +0 healer uniform
  • a blessed +0 pair of low boots
  • 5-10 uncursed apples
  • 5-10 blessed eucalyptus leaves
  • a blessed spellbook of healing
  • a blessed spellbook of extra healing
  • a blessed spellbook of stone to flesh
  • 4 non-cursed potions of healing
  • 4 non-cursed potions of extra healing
  • wand of sleep (4-8 charges)
  • an uncursed stethoscope
  • an uncursed oil lamp

Healers start with knowledge of the potion of full healing's randomized appearance.

The Healer's default starting pet is a little dog or kitten with equal probability.

Intrinsics

Healers gain the following intrinsic properties upon reaching the given experience levels:

  • Level 1: Poison resistance
  • Level 1: Immunity to sickness
  • Level 15: Warning

Attributes

The Healer's starting attributes are distributed as follows:

Attributes Strength Dexterity Constitution Intelligence Wisdom Charisma Remaining
Minimum attributes 7 7 11 13 11 16 10
Distribution percentages 5% 15% 25% 30% 20% 5%

Skills

Healers have the following skills available to them before racial adjustments:

Healer skills
Max Skills
Basic
  • Weapons: scimitar, saber, mace, polearms, spear, javelin, trident
  • Combat: bare hands
  • Spells: wand damage
Skilled
  • Weapons: dagger, short sword, club, sling, shuriken
Expert
  • Weapons: knife, quarterstaff, farm implements, dart, unicorn horn
  • Combat: beast mastery
  • Spells: healing

Healers start with Basic skill in knife, quarterstaff and healing spells, and use the intelligence stat to cast spells. Their special spell is full healing.

Special rules

Healers gain experience and a +1 alignment record bonus for healing pets and peaceful monsters.

Healers do not suffer damage or attribute loss from quaffing a potion of sickness and are immune to their vapors, though quaffing the potion will still cure hallucination.

A Healer can apply a stethoscope to a statue to determine whether it contains items or is on a statue trap; they can also more reliably apply a stethoscope to themselves while engulfed by a whirly monster.

Healers gain a +10 bonus to their natural HP regeneration rate and a +6 bonus to their natural power regeneration rate.

Healers have an increased chance of obtaining a tame minion from an altar as a sacrifice boon.

Healers gain reduced spell failure rates for all spells while wielding a khakkhara, bell, effigy, or scalpel (including artifacts).

Healers can safely extract the fang from the hearts of Jrt Netjer in hell vaults, and can safely free monsters from vivisection traps - this will tame the monster in both cases.

Healers have a +0.5 base attack bonus per experience level, and gain to-hit and damage bonuses for attacks with scalpels and unicorn horns based on their skill in healing spells: +0 for Basic, +2 for Skilled, and +5 for Expert.

Healers can make sneak attacks with knives.

Healers are capable of determining roughly how much HP a vampiric or living monster has left: A phrase is appended to the monster's name whenever the Healer sees them take any action, and is also displayed when using far look.

Healers apply a bonus to their pets' threshold for experience gain, maximum level, AC, and DR based on each of their skills in beast mastery and healing spells: +1 for Basic, +2 for Skilled, and +5 for Expert. Wielding Clarent or carrying it as an alternate weapon doubles the bonuses from beast mastery.

Rank titles

The status line displays one of the following ranks for the corresponding experience levels:

  • XL 1-2: Rhizotomist
  • XL 3-5: Empiric
  • XL 6-9: Embalmer
  • XL 10-13: Dresser
  • XL 14-17: Medicus ossium/Medica ossium
  • XL 18-21: Herbalist
  • XL 22-25: Magister/Magistra
  • XL 26-29: Physician
  • XL 30: Chirurgeon

Gods

Main article: Religion

The standard Healer pantheon is based on the mythology of ancient Greece.

  • Lawful: Athena
  • Neutral: Hermes
  • Chaotic: Poseidon

Quest

Main article: Healer quest/dNetHack

As in the standard quest for NetHack, the Healer's quest sees them fighting the Cyclops for The Staff of Aesculapius, an artifact silver-shod serpent-entwined staff. Additionally, the Healer will encounter many monsters that have fallen victim to a plague inflicted upon them by the Cyclops and his machinations.

A Healer can gain access to their quest if the average of their experience level and the monster level of their pet with the highest level is 14 or higher.

The Staff of Aesculapius grants hungerless regeneration and drain resistance while wielded, and deals double damage to all monsters without drain resistance and drains levels from them on each hit - this life-draining applies a further +1d8 damage to the target's current and maximum HP, and restores half of that damage to the wielder's current HP. Invoking The Staff of Aesculapius heals the user by half of the HP needed to return to full health, and cures sickness, blindness not caused by gunk (e.g. from a cream pie) and sliming. Reading The Staff of Aesculapius teaches the mass healing spell. Applying the non-cursed Staff can cure status ailments for the wielder or other allied monsters similar to a unicorn horn, and inflicts status ailments on opposing monsters while completely ignoring monster MR - this is reversed if the Staff is cursed, and in all cases skips over ailments that do not apply (for curing) or else cannot be applied (for inflicting). The status ailments cured or applied in order of priority are: blindness, deafness, stunning and confusion, sleep, paralysis, cancellation, and plague.

Strategy

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"Detail to match the layout of other NetHack role strategy sections if possible."

{{tocright}}
In dNetHack, the '''Healer''' is one of the [[role]]s available to the [[hero]]. 

Healers can be [[Human (starting race)|humans]], [[Gnome (starting race)|gnomes]], [[Elf (starting race)|elves]], or [[Yuki-onna (starting race)|yuki-onna]], and are always [[neutral]].

[[Drow Healer]]s and hedrow Healers are treated as radically different from their counterparts, with their own articles available in the provided link.

==Starting equipment==
Each Healer starts with the following equipment:

* 1001-2000 [[gold piece]]s
* a blessed +0 [[scalpel]] <!--([[wielded]])-->
* a blessed +0 [[quarterstaff]]
* an uncursed +1 pair of [[leather gloves|gloves]]
* a blessed +0 [[healer uniform]]
* a blessed +0 pair of [[low boots]]
* 5-10 uncursed [[apple]]s
* 5-10 blessed [[eucalyptus leaves]]
* a blessed [[spellbook of healing]]
* a blessed [[spellbook of extra healing]]
* a blessed [[spellbook of stone to flesh]]
* 4 non-cursed [[potions of healing]]
* 4 non-cursed [[potions of extra healing]]
* [[wand of sleep]] (4-8 charges)
* an uncursed [[stethoscope]]
* an uncursed [[oil lamp]]

Healers start with knowledge of the [[potion of full healing]]'s randomized appearance.

The Healer's default starting [[pet]] is a [[little dog]] or [[kitten]] with equal probability.

==Intrinsics==
Healers gain the following intrinsic [[properties]] upon reaching the given [[experience level]]s:

* Level 1: [[Poison resistance]]
* Level 1: [[Immunity to sickness]]
* Level 15: [[Warning]]

==Attributes==
The Healer's starting [[attribute]]s are distributed as follows:

==Skills==
Healers have the following [[skill]]s available to them before racial adjustments:

|-

| Basic

* ''Weapons:'' [[scimitar]], [[saber]], [[mace]], [[polearms]], [[spear]], [[javelin]], [[trident]]

Healers start with ''Basic'' skill in ''knife'', ''quarterstaff'' and ''healing spells'', and use the intelligence stat to cast spells. Their [[special spell]] is {{+ of|full healing}}.

==Special rules==
Healers gain experience and a +1 [[alignment record]] bonus for healing [[pet]]s and peaceful monsters.

Healers do not suffer damage or [[attribute]] loss from quaffing a [[potion of sickness]] and are immune to their [[vapor]]s, though quaffing the potion will still cure [[hallucination]].

A Healer can apply a stethoscope to a [[statue]] to determine whether it contains items or is on a [[statue trap]]; they can also more reliably apply a stethoscope to themselves while [[engulfed]] by a [[whirly]] monster.

Healers gain a +10 bonus to their natural [[HP]] regeneration rate and a +6 bonus to their natural [[power]] regeneration rate.<!--in dNetHack both are calculated in terms of value-per-90-turns-->

Healers have an increased chance of obtaining a tame [[minion]] from an [[altar]] as a [[sacrifice]] boon.

Healers gain reduced spell failure rates for all spells while wielding a [[khakkhara]], [[bell]], [[effigy]], or scalpel (including [[artifact]]s).

Healers can safely extract the fang from the hearts of [[Jrt Netjer]] in hell vaults, and can safely free monsters from vivisection traps - this will tame the monster in both cases.

Healers have a +0.5 [[base attack bonus]] per experience level, and gain [[to-hit]] and damage bonuses for attacks with scalpels and unicorn horns based on their skill in healing spells: +0 for Basic, +2 for Skilled, and +5 for Expert.

Healers can make [[Sneak attack (dNetHack)|sneak attacks]] with knives.<!--This is bugged and intended to apply to any knife skill weapon-->

Healers are capable of determining roughly how much HP a vampiric or living monster has left: A phrase is appended to the monster's name whenever the Healer sees them take any action, and is also displayed when using [[far look]].

Healers apply a bonus to their pets' threshold for experience gain, maximum level, [[AC]], and [[DR]] based on each of their skills in beast mastery and healing spells: +1 for Basic, +2 for Skilled, and +5 for Expert. Wielding [[Clarent]] or carrying it as an alternate weapon doubles the bonuses from beast mastery.

==Rank titles==
The [[status line]] displays one of the following ranks for the corresponding experience levels:

*XL 1-2: Rhizotomist
*XL 3-5: Empiric
*XL 6-9: Embalmer
*XL 10-13: Dresser
*XL 14-17: Medicus ossium/Medica ossium
*XL 18-21: Herbalist
*XL 22-25: Magister/Magistra
*XL 26-29: Physician
*XL 30: Chirurgeon

==Gods==
{{main|Religion}}
The standard Healer pantheon is based on [[Wikipedia:Greek mythology|the mythology of ancient Greece]].

* Lawful: [[Athena]]
* Neutral: [[Hermes]]
* Chaotic: [[Poseidon]]

==Quest==
{{main|Healer quest/dNetHack}}
As in [[Healer quest|the standard quest]] for ''[[NetHack]]'', the Healer's [[quest]] sees them fighting the [[Cyclops]] for [[The Staff of Aesculapius]], an artifact [[silver]]-shod [[serpent-entwined staff]]. Additionally, the Healer will encounter many monsters that have fallen victim to a plague inflicted upon them by the Cyclops and his machinations.

A Healer can gain access to their quest if the average of their experience level and the [[monster level]] of their pet with the highest level is 14 or higher.

The Staff of Aesculapius grants hungerless [[regeneration]] and [[drain resistance]] while [[wield]]ed, and deals [[double damage]] to all monsters without [[drain resistance]] and drains levels from them on each hit - this life-draining applies a further +1d8 damage to the target's current and maximum HP, and restores half of that damage to the wielder's current HP. [[Invoking]] The Staff of Aesculapius heals the user by half of the HP needed to return to full health, and cures [[sickness]], [[blindness]] not caused by gunk (e.g. from a [[cream pie]]) and [[sliming]]. [[Reading]] The Staff of Aesculapius teaches the {{+ of|mass healing}} spell. [[Apply]]ing the non-cursed Staff can cure status ailments for the wielder or other allied monsters similar to a [[unicorn horn]], and inflicts status ailments on opposing monsters while completely ignoring [[Magic resistance (monster)|monster MR]] - this is reversed if the Staff is cursed, and in all cases skips over ailments that do not apply (for curing) or else cannot be applied (for inflicting). The status ailments cured or applied in order of priority are: blindness, [[deafness]], [[stunning]] and [[confusion]], [[sleep]], [[paralysis]], [[cancellation]], and plague.
